name: Ólafsfjörður Swimming Pool - Black Hole Slide Destination
description: Ólafsfjörður Swimming Pool serves this remote fishing town of approximately 700 residents tucked at the head of a dramatic fjord on Tröllaskagi peninsula's northeastern coast with an unexpectedly comprehensive aquatic facility featuring two waterslides including an exciting 52.5-meter "black hole" enclosed slide that has become regionally famous, drawing waterslide enthusiasts from across North Iceland to this small-town pool. Ólafsfjörður is one of Iceland's most dramatically situated communities, enclosed by towering mountains that rise directly from the fjord, creating an almost claustrophobic setting of sheer peaks surrounding the narrow coastal flat where the town occupies every available meter of buildable land. The town's isolation was legendary until 2010 when the Múlabjargsvegur tunnel opened, finally providing year-round road access that previously required traversing a mountain pass impassable during winter storms—prior to the tunnel, Ólafsfjörður sometimes faced weeks of complete isolation. Despite its small size, Ólafsfjörður invested in quality recreational infrastructure including a swimming pool that punches well above its weight in amenities and has earned reputation for exceptional waterslides. The main pool measuring 8 x 25 meters accommodates lap swimming and general recreation with comfortable geothermal heating year-round. Two hot tubs at precisely controlled temperatures—one at 38°C (100°F) and another at 40°C (104°F)—allow bathers to select preferred heat intensity, with one hot tub featuring Jacuzzi jets for massage effects.
